intro: Uragoga virgata, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, waxy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub with dense foliage and produces flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white. It thrives in humid, well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth. Uragoga virgata is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
